Record.Term: Yttrium Y 90 DOTA Monoclonal Antibody HuPAM4
Record.ClassificationPath: Chemicals_and_Drugs_Kind/Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material/Pharmacologic Substance/Radiopharmaceutical Compound/Radioimmunoconjugate/Yttrium Y 90 DOTA Monoclonal Antibody HuPAM4
Record.BroaderTerm: Yttrium Y 90 DOTA Monoclonal Antibody HuPAM4
Drug, Food, Chemical or Biomedical Material
Record.Synonym: Yttrium Y 90 DOTA Monoclonal Antibody HuPAM4
Record.Description: A radioimmunoconjugate comprised of the humanized monoclonal antibody HuPAM4, directed against the pancreatic cancer antigen MUC1, that is conjugated to the chelating agent tetra-azacyclododecanetetra-acetic acid (DOTA) and radiolabeled with the beta-emitting radioisotope Yttrium Y90. Yttrium Y 90 DOTA monoclonal antibody HuPAM4 binds to tumor cells expressing MUC1 antigen, selectively delivering a cytotoxic dose of beta radiation. (NCI05)
